patterns: What to do if my credit card is stolen
responses: Stolen credit card fraud involves unauthorized use of credit card information for fraudulent transactions. If you suspect such activity, don't accept the transaction and report the buyer information in the buyer information tab in the application, to protect other sellers.

Address fraud involves the use of fake or manipulated addresses in online transactions. Be cautious when dealing with orders that seem to use questionable addresses, and report any suspicious activity to the appropriate authorities.

Scammers may employ address fraud to deceive individuals or organizations. Stay alert to unusual address patterns in online purchases, and report any concerns to the relevant parties for investigation.

Address verification scams can be a form of fraud. If you suspect address fraud in online transactions, take steps to verify the legitimacy of the information and report any discrepancies to prevent potential fraud.

Refund before returning product can be a fraudulent tactic. Exercise caution when someone requests a refund before the product is returned. Verify the legitimacy of the request and follow the established refund policies.

Be aware of refund scams where individuals request a refund before returning the purchased item. It's essential to adhere to the standard refund procedures and report any suspicious requests to prevent fraud.

Fraudsters may attempt to exploit refund processes by requesting a refund before returning the product. Familiarize yourself with the online purchase refund policy and be cautious of any deviations from standard procedures.

Unusual purchase fraud may involve atypical order amounts or quantities in the shopping basket. Stay vigilant and review orders that seem out of the ordinary to prevent potential fraudulent transactions.

If you notice unexpected quantities or unusually high/low purchase amounts in the shopping basket, it could be a sign of fraud. Investigate such orders thoroughly and take necessary precautions to ensure the legitimacy of the transaction.

Fraudsters may manipulate order quantities or amounts to carry out online fraud. Be proactive in identifying and flagging any unusual purchases and implement additional verification steps to safeguard against fraudulent activities.

responses: A data breach occurs when cybercriminals hack into organizations' databases and steal sensitive information. The data, which can be exposed to the public, may include passwords, account numbers, correspondence, names, home addresses, Social Security numbers, and more.
